issue.title: abcya.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.50.1b6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.abcya.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, EasyList Cookie List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Cookie filter list causes a gap to appear at the top of the page.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.50.1b5

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://revadvert.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Base filter, EasyList, uBlock filters

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
AdGuard - Other Annoyances has the filter `##.td_block_social_counter`. It seems better to add it to the Social filter list.

Also, in uBlock filters, `revadvert.com##^script:has-text(fakeAd)` is used to get rid of the Anti-AdBlock message instead of just `revadvert.com###AdbModel`.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot from 2023-06-22 18-46-11](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/89158249/986e4e26-2bfc-4025-a4fd-73a7f538efd6)

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
>AdGuard - Other Annoyances has the filter `##.td_block_social_counter`. It seems better to add it to the Social filter list.

We do not block such elements in social filter, so it's okay.

>Also, in uBlock filters, `revadvert.com##^script:has-text(fakeAd)` is used to get rid of the Anti-AdBlock message instead of just `revadvert.com###AdbModel`.

`revadvert.com###AdbModel` is compatible with all extensions/apps, while `##^` rules are supported only by extension for Firefox and apps (Android, Mac, Windows), so it's not necessary in this case.

Firefox

Desktop

AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Base filter, EasyList, uBlock filters

_No response_

1. <comment>
AdGuard - Other Annoyances has the filter `##.td_block_social_counter`. It seems better to add it to the Social filter list.

comment.body:
It works fine on my end after updating filters.
As far as I can see, there is an issue about this domain - https://github.com/easylist/easylistchina/issues/342
I'm not sure if I understand correctly, but it looks like that it's some kind of CDN - `https://cdnjs.tacool.com/`, so maybe adding `||tacool.com^$badfilter` will be a better solution in this case.

It seems that you have enabled HTTPS filtering for dcisnide app.
Please disable it and use DNS filters list in its DNS module.

<details><summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

디시인사이드 앱에 대해 HTTPS 필터링을 활셩화하신 것 같습니다.
비활성화해주시고, DNS 모듈에 있는 DNS 필터를 사용해주세요.

</details>

comment.body:
> Good thing the page opens without filters or stealth mode.
> 
> > AdGuard Basic Filter and the AdGuard Anti-Tracking Protection filter intercepted the request.
> 
> I see you mentioned these two filters. Try to leave only one of them without stealth mode and check the site. If you can't open the site, disable one of them and check again.
> 
> @AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers please take a look at this.

@zloyden Hello! Only AdGuard Basic Filter is left to open the web page. Only the AdGuard Anti-Tracking Protection filter can also open the web page. Two filters can be opened together to open web pages, how strange! I tried turning on all my previous filters (without stealth mode) again, which was also accessible. It seems to be a problem with stealth mode.

> The site opens fine on my end. Try to do next:
> 
> 1. Disable `McAfee`.
> 2. In AdGuard disable stealth mode and all the filters, but leave the protection
> 3. Clear browser data, restart it
> 4. Open the site

@zloyden Hello! I can open this page according to your method, but I can't open it after turning on the filter and stealth mode. Why? Do you have a way to solve it?

comment.body:
The site opens fine on my end.
Try to do next:
1. Disable `McAfee`.
2. In AdGuard disable stealth mode and all the filters, but leave the protection
3. Clear browser data, restart it
4. Open the site

comment.body: > Hm, let's do next: > > 1. Update the app to the latest nightly - AdGuard for Windows 7.13 n18 > 2. Disable the filters or the antibanner module > 3. Turn the stealth mode on > 4. Open the filtering log and then the site in private mode > 5. If you get the error, try to disable those options one by one to find the problematic one > 6. Tell us which of the options might break the site and send the screenshot of the filtering log here. @zloyden Hello! I always had the feeling that this log showed a problem with stealth mode. Please see the picture.

Hm, let's do next:
1. Update the app to the latest nightly - AdGuard for Windows 7.13 n18
2. Disable the filters or the antibanner module
3. Turn the stealth mode on
4. Open the filtering log and then the site in private mode
5. If you get the error, try to disable those options one by one to find the problematic one
6. Tell us which of the options might break the site and send the screenshot of the filtering log here.

comment.body:
It's really strange.
1. Disable all other extensions not related to AdGuard
2. Leave only stealth mode in AdGuard, filters should be disabled. If you have the same stealth mode options as in the report, there is no need to write them here.
3. Open the filtering log and keep it on the background
4. Reproduce the problem
5. Send the screenshot from the filtering log here.

comment.body:
Hello,

I can't reproduce the problem with your settings.

1. Please go to settings > Safari > extensions, disable all AdGuard extensions and enable them again.
2. Go to the AdGuard app and update the filters, wait 2-3 minutes without closing the app.
3. Reboot your device
4. Go to this site and check for ads, there shouldn't be any.

If this does not help, please contact our support: support@adguard.com

### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)

If you have the same stealth mode options as in the report, there is no need to write them here. > 3. Open the filtering log and keep it on the background > 4. Reproduce the problem > 5. Send the screenshot from the filtering log here. @zloyden

comment.body:
There's nothing unusual there. As I understand it, the problem is on your side in stealth mode. Try disabling these options one by one until the site opens.
Please also say what the status of the `tacool.com` do you have. You can watch it using developer tools.
Before loading the site do:
1. Open new private tab in Edge
2. Press `F12`, select the `Network` tab - press on the `Preserve log`
3. Open the site
4. You wiil see the requests with statuses - it's the second column
5. Make and send the screenshot from the dev tools here.

@AdamWr : Thanks for fixing this. However, the fake buttons appear on further new domains on that site. For example, when we click the play button on any video, it redirects us to another domain (locenterylstry.monster), The domain changes almost every day.
